bibl.title: New Greek Papyri from a Cave in Mount Yishai, Near Ein-Gedi.
bibl.note: Two badly preserved papyri discovered in November 2002. Last decade of I - 30's of II century CE. - 1. A Land / Property Transaction (?) / Loan. - 2. A Document of Unknown Character. - [Now published by: IDEM, New Greek Papyri from a Cave in the Vicinity of Ein Gedi, SCI 25 (2006) pp. 81-95.]

bibl.title: Proceedings of the 24th International Congress of Papyrology, Helsinki, 1-7 August, 2004. Volume I

bibl.seg: COHEN Nahum, New Greek Papyri from a Cave in Mount Yishai, Near Ein-Gedi.

Jaakko FRÖSÉN, Tiina PUROLA and Erja SALMENKIVI (Edd.), Proceedings of the 24th International Congress of Papyrology, Helsinki, 1-7 August, 2004. Volume I = Commentationes Humanarum Litterarum. 122, 1, 2007 (Helsinki, 2007) pp. 191-197 et pll. coul. IV-V.

Two badly preserved papyri discovered in November 2002. Last decade of I - 30's of II century CE. - 1. A Land / Property Transaction (?) / Loan. - 2. A Document of Unknown Character. - [Now published by: IDEM, New Greek Papyri from a Cave in the Vicinity of Ein Gedi, SCI 25 (2006) pp. 81-95.]
